misdeed: A series of pranks and mishaps plagues a once-prosperous farm. Tools disappear, milk sours overnight, and crops fail, despite the farmer's best efforts. Whispers of a mischievous spirit haunting the barn spread amongst the worried farmhands.
solution: The Vaesen is a Nisse and can be driven away by offering it a new piece of clothing, stopping all offerings and gifts, or by offending it, often by soiling its porridge.

clues.description: Small, hand-shaped footprints appear in flour spilled on the pantry floor, too small to belong to any human.
The farmhands report hearing the faint sound of someone sweeping the barn floor at midnight, but find it spotless when they investigate.
The farmer discovers an elaborately braided knot in his horse's mane, one he cannot undo, no matter how hard he tries.
A bowl of porridge, left out as an offering for the supposed spirit, is found half-eaten, the spoon neatly placed beside it.
An old farmhand recounts tales of a mischievous spirit, small and bearded, who protects those who respect the farm and punishes those who do not.
The farmer's daughter claims to have seen a tiny man in a red cap sitting on a bale of hay, watching her with a mischievous glint in his eyes.

plotTwist.description: The farmer's son, jealous of his father's attention and hoping to inherit the farm, has been secretly trying to drive the Vaesen away, unaware that he's making matters worse.
